title: how to carry harder?
body:
I'm one of these "but i won my lane" guys. I do my job and more often than not I win the lane, and I can identify pretty early when I wont so I hug and farm and dont feed.

But I keep going down in rank. My lane mechanics are pretty decent but my carry potential sucks a whole lot of ass.

Am just finding that irrespective of how I do in lane, my team mates seem to suck more than the other guys and we lose.

Am not good enough to carry potatoes, but I want to be.

Any tips to go from lane winner to game winner?

replies.body: trudat. Rage control is something I struggle with at the moment. After promos I got shunted back down 5 full divisions and am now sliding further because of the tilt....

Thing is go play a different champion other then just the ones you feel comfortable with, go for more champs like Lux or Brand who arent team reliant because all in champs are more likely to get nuked and your team will be useless with you dead, and take your jungles wolves or birds when you are pushed out, assassins arent really great in bronze- only if you are really ahead so consider switching up champions that are more safe
I really find this with xin. In a pre made with team synergy I bring a lot to the team but in yolo q my xin is very unreliable.
Don't yell at your teammates, it's just bad etiquette and they will resent you for it
Yeah the more I tilt the more I rage. The more I rage the more I tilt.

Check out this video by our University of New South Wales LoL Club
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=iQr0dgCYKhw
Get a small lead, shove your lane then roam. Your laner won't be able to respond (or at least they'll take a while) and you'll help out your team and let them carry themselves easier.

after wining lane (top lane main) I tend to head into enemy jungle and ward as much as I can, take the enemy jungle camps and such.
I always watch top lane for the opponent incase he gets to much solo time so I try to shut him down more, if all of that is good ill help out mid lane to either try get them ahead or get them a advantage so he is able to handle himself to either do the same as me and head into there jungle or help our bot lane....
I find pushing objectives faster if my other lanes are going even tends to bring enemy jungler to my lane a lot more so it eases my jungler and other lanes knowing im drawing 80% of the enemy junglers attention and constan 2v1's or 3v1's incase enemy mid laner  or support joins the fight......objective control is a big part...taking early dragons rift herald and even the crab for that extra free vision try shot calling objectives like "heading bot to help push it out and take turret" ect can help....im only a silver noob but that normally helps me win my games

Sorry if this seems rude and stuff, Im just going by match history.

Sivir:
You never completed an item by 25 mins, items all over the place.
Didn't upgrade trinket.
100 CS by 25 mins, should at least have been 160. 80 per 10 mins.

Diana:
Completed items, which is good, but I don't main diana so I dont know if either Ludens or Lichbane first would have been better.
141 CS by 31 Mins, should have at least been 220.
Im not sure if you were top or mid given your team comp. But if you were Top. TP would have helped to gank lanes or contest objectives.
If mid, Im not sure if you roamed, seems like there Top and jungle got really fed off bot. You should have tried to camp it aswell.

Diana 2:
More completed items, better CS even tho it still should have been over 200.
It seems that everyone on your team did well on this game.
But it seems as tho your entire team was waaaaay to focused on kills.
You got no objectives this game, thus making it easier for the enemy to win.

Volibear: 
40 mins and 127 CS, should have been at least 240.
You build ok apart from 1 thing. You should have gotten a banshies. The MR helps with Annie, Lissandra and Malphite.
And also cancels a spell, allowing you to either continue a chase, or be the front line that you are.

And more objectives this game, but still not enough.

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

That's all I can tell tho from the match history from these games,

my recent sivir match did suck - our lane got rinsed. I tried to counter pick cait but the leo counterpicked herself into morg and the poke was too much. but yeah we sucked that game. Shame cause I am usually ok with siv.

diana I am getting more confident at - took the advice on another thread to rush hourglass and that has helped a lot. But I still suck at early game farm with her. Having trouble balancing the last hit with the need to get in melee range to deliver it. I find this very hard against poke champs. something I can deffo improve on.

the voli you looked at was jg voli - would I be expecting the same sort of CS at that point? I try not to AFK farm in jg. 

I guess my focus are the games that I lose where I am 11/5/4, 7/4/20, 16/4/9, 4/4/11. They're the ones I feel I should have more impact on and get very frustrated with losing.

> [{quoted}](name=Essembie,realm=OCE,application-id=FjGAIbRv,discussion-id=pcHGOrYM,comment-id=00040000,timestamp=2016-01-30T09:07:09.179+0000)
>
> my recent sivir match did suck - our lane got rinsed. I tried to counter pick cait but the leo counterpicked herself into morg and the poke was too much. but yeah we sucked that game. Shame cause I am usually ok with siv.
> 
> diana I am getting more confident at - took the advice on another thread to rush hourglass and that has helped a lot. But I still suck at early game farm with her. Having trouble balancing the last hit with the need to get in melee range to deliver it. I find this very hard against poke champs. something I can deffo improve on.
> 
> the voli you looked at was jg voli - would I be expecting the same sort of CS at that point? I try not to AFK farm in jg. 
> 
> I guess my focus are the games that I lose where I am 11/5/4, 7/4/20, 16/4/9, 4/4/11. They're the ones I feel I should have more impact on and get very frustrated with losing.

The games where you're 11/5 and 7/4  when did you have your last death? Was it late game when the death timers are really long, and you've had the gold and item edge for your team? But when you died your team lost the advantage and the other team could take control and go onto win?
Yeah pretty much this. Team mate gets caught out of position and they bum rush us.

How many kills or advantages is ignite getting you when you run it in the game? Is it worth having it? Try running tp on diana and then getting distortion upgrade on boots. Not saying it's going to stop teammates getting caught out but could help you catch out people on the other team.

would you recommend heal mid? I tend to take ignite out of habit from using morg and ahri mid (they have vamp and passive respectively for health sustain) and I take heal on xer because I never let him get in ignite range. 

you reckon heal better for diana?

I'm not sure about heal, I mean there is no reason why you couldn't run it in one match and see how it goes for you. If you run tp then you have the option of catching out other members like that adc chasing the juicy wave, or split pushing while tp is up having the option to join your team if it's all about to go down

During champ select just have a look at who you will be up against and think what summoner will be best suited for you. I've found myself running cleanse more often than not in mid now. It's just whatever summoner you think will be most beneficial to you in the match up or game you're about to enter

Well, what champions are you playing? I find that I can carry SUPER hard on some champions and not as much on others. I also sometimes change my build, even as a mid laner to a more supportive build if I find that someone else on my team is doing incredibly well and dish out the damage while I provide the utility.

I feel you. I main burst mages, and 9 times out of 10 when my lane gets fed, none of those kills are actually me. Yet I'm just not good enough to do anything with my score. Nothing feels worse than going 10/0 and having no idea where to apply your power.

The best advice I can give you is to try and master people with reasonable mobility that can dish out either some aoe, some cc, or both. That way even if you're behind, if your mechanical skills are good enough, you can avoid them and shut them down.

Examples would be ap Ezreal with a Rylais or Ahri, Nautilus is also always a good option, and if you're aiming for the mid-late game "I don't care about you mortals" Rammus or tank Warwick. Tank Warwick is slow to start, but if you get him rolling you can chase that adc to the nexus and be totally fine, not even kidding.
